DOC.brief_summary: This study will examine if one of the following methods: pupillometry, spectral analysis of heart rate variability and metaiodobenzylguanidine scintigraphy, is more capable to detect early diabetic autonomic neuropathy in patients with type 1 diabetes mellitus
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Between Pupillometry, Heart Rate Variability and Metaiodobenzylguanidine Scintigraphy for the Diagnosis of Early Diabetic Autonomic Neuropathy in Type 1 Diabetes
DOC.criteria: Type 1 diabetes mellitus Type 2 diabetes mellitus Severe cardiac autonomic neuropathy Medications other than insulin Ocular disease other than refractive eye disorders History of neurologic disease History of cardiovascular disease Thyroid disease Vitamin B insufficiency Other possible cause for autonomic failure
